00135 static void lgss_krb5_mutex_lock(void)
00136 {
00137         if (lgss_mutex_lock(LGSS_MUTEX_KRB5)) {
00138                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "can't lock process, abort!\n");
00139                 exit(-1);
00140         }
00141 }
00142 
00143 static void lgss_krb5_mutex_unlock(void)
00144 {
00145         if (lgss_mutex_unlock(LGSS_MUTEX_KRB5)) {
00146                 logmsg(LL_WARN, "can't unlock process, other processes "
00147                        "might need to wait long time\n");
00148         }
00149 }
00150 
00151 /*
00152  * NOTE
00153  *  - currently we only support "normal" cache types: "FILE" and "MEMORY".
00154  */
00155 
00156 #define krb5_err_msg(code)      error_message(code)
00157 
00158 const char *krb5_cc_type_mem    = "MEMORY:";
00159 const char *krb5_cc_type_file   = "FILE:";
00160 const char *krb5_cred_root_suffix  = "lustre_root";
00161 const char *krb5_cred_mds_suffix   = "lustre_mds";
00162 const char *krb5_cred_oss_suffix   = "lustre_oss";
00163 
00164 char    *krb5_this_realm        = NULL;
00165 char    *krb5_keytab_file       = "/etc/krb5.keytab";
00166 char    *krb5_cc_type           = "FILE:";
00167 char    *krb5_cc_dir            = "/tmp";
00168 char    *krb5_cred_prefix       = "krb5cc_";
00169 
00170 struct lgss_krb5_cred {
00171         char            kc_ccname[128];
00172         int             kc_remove;        /* remove cache upon release */
00173 };
00174 
00175 static
00176 int lgss_krb5_set_ccache_name(const char *ccname)
00177 {
00178 #ifdef USE_GSS_KRB5_CCACHE_NAME
00179         unsigned int    maj_stat, min_stat;
00180 
00181         maj_stat = gss_krb5_ccache_name(&min_stat, ccname, NULL);
00182         if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00183                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "failed to set ccache name\n");
00184                 return -1;
00185         }
00186 #else
00187         /*
00188          * Set the KRB5CCNAME environment variable to tell the krb5 code
00189          * which credentials cache to use.  (Instead of using the private
00190          * function above for which there is no generic gssapi equivalent)
00191          */
00192         if (setenv("KRB5CCNAME", ccname, 1)) {
00193                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "set env of krb5 ccname: %s\n",
00194                        strerror(errno));
00195                 return -1;
00196         }
00197 #endif
00198         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "set cc: %s\n", ccname);
00199         return 0;
00200 }
00201 
00202 static
00203 int lgss_krb5_get_local_realm(void)
00204 {
00205         krb5_context    context = NULL;
00206         krb5_error_code code;
00207         int             retval = -1;
00208 
00209         if (krb5_this_realm != NULL)
00210                 return 0;
00211 
00212         code = krb5_init_context(&context);
00213         if (code) {
00214                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "init ctx: %s\n", krb5_err_msg(code));
00215                 return -1;
00216         }
00217 
00218         code = krb5_get_default_realm(context, &krb5_this_realm);
00219         if (code) {
00220                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "get default realm: %s\n", krb5_err_msg(code));
00221                 goto out;
00222         }
00223 
00224         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "Local realm: %s\n", krb5_this_realm);
00225         retval = 0;
00226 out:
00227         krb5_free_context(context);
00228         return retval;
00229 }
00230 
00231 static
00232 int princ_is_local_realm(krb5_context ctx, krb5_principal princ)
00233 {
00234         return (lgss_krb5_strcasecmp(krb5_princ_realm(ctx, princ),
00235                                      krb5_this_realm) == 0);
00236 }
00237 
00238 static
00239 int svc_princ_verify_host(krb5_context ctx,
00240                           krb5_principal princ,
00241                           uint64_t self_nid,
00242                           loglevel_t loglevel)
00243 {
00244         struct utsname utsbuf;
00245         struct hostent *host;
00246         const int max_namelen = 512;
00247         char namebuf[max_namelen];
00248         char *h_name;
00249 
00250         if (krb5_princ_component(ctx, princ, 1) == NULL) {
00251                 logmsg(loglevel, "service principal has no host part\n");
00252                 return -1;
00253         }
00254 
00255         if (self_nid != 0) {
00256                 if (lnet_nid2hostname(self_nid, namebuf, max_namelen)) {
00257                         logmsg(loglevel,
00258                                "can't resolve hostname from nid %"PRIx64"\n",
00259                                self_nid);
00260                         return -1;
00261                 }
00262                 h_name = namebuf;
00263         } else {
00264                 if (uname(&utsbuf)) {
00265                         logmsg(loglevel, "get UTS name: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00266                         return -1;
00267                 }
00268 
00269                 host = gethostbyname(utsbuf.nodename);
00270                 if (host == NULL) {
00271                         logmsg(loglevel, "failed to get local hostname\n");
00272                         return -1;
00273                 }
00274                 h_name = host->h_name;
00275         }
00276 
00277         if (lgss_krb5_strcasecmp(krb5_princ_component(ctx, princ, 1),
00278                                  h_name)) {
00279                 logmsg(loglevel, "service principal: hostname %.*s "
00280                        "doesn't match localhost %s\n",
00281                        krb5_princ_component(ctx, princ, 1)->length,
00282                        krb5_princ_component(ctx, princ, 1)->data,
00283                        h_name);
00284                 return -1;
00285         }
00286 
00287         return 0;
00288 }
00289 
00290 static
00291 int lkrb5_cc_check_tgt_princ(krb5_context ctx,
00292                              krb5_ccache ccache,
00293                              krb5_principal princ,
00294                              unsigned int flag,
00295                              uint64_t self_nid)
00296 {
00297         const char     *princ_name;
00298 
00299         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "principal: realm %.*s, type %d, size %d, name %.*s\n",
00300                krb5_princ_realm(ctx, princ)->length,
00301                krb5_princ_realm(ctx, princ)->data,
00302                krb5_princ_type(ctx, princ),
00303                krb5_princ_size(ctx, princ),
00304                krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ)->length,
00305                krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ)->data);
00306 
00307         /* check type */
00308         if (krb5_princ_type(ctx, princ) != KRB5_NT_PRINCIPAL) {
00309                 logmsg(LL_WARN, "principal type %d is not I want\n",
00310                        krb5_princ_type(ctx, princ));
00311                 return -1;
00312         }
00313 
00314         /* check local realm */
00315         if (!princ_is_local_realm(ctx, princ)) {
00316                 logmsg(LL_WARN, "principal realm %.*s not local: %s\n",
00317                        krb5_princ_realm(ctx, princ)->length,
00318                        krb5_princ_realm(ctx, princ)->data,
00319                        krb5_this_realm);
00320                 return -1;
00321         }
00322 
00323         /* check principal name */
00324         switch (flag) {
00325         case LGSS_ROOT_CRED_ROOT:
00326                 princ_name = LGSS_USR_ROOT_STR;
00327                 break;
00328         case LGSS_ROOT_CRED_MDT:
00329                 princ_name = LGSS_SVC_MDS_STR;
00330                 break;
00331         case LGSS_ROOT_CRED_OST:
00332                 princ_name = LGSS_SVC_OSS_STR;
00333                 break;
00334         default:
00335                 lassert(0);
00336         }
00337 
00338         if (lgss_krb5_strcmp(krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ), princ_name)) {
00339                 logmsg(LL_WARN, "%.*s: we expect %s instead\n",
00340                        krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ)->length,
00341                        krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ)->data,
00342                        princ_name);
00343                 return -1;
00344         }
00345 
00346         /*
00347          * verify the hostname part of the principal, except we do allow
00348          * lustre_root without binding to a host.
00349          */
00350         if (krb5_princ_component(ctx, princ, 1) == NULL) {
00351                 if (flag != LGSS_ROOT_CRED_ROOT) {
00352                         logmsg(LL_WARN, "%.*s: missing hostname\n",
00353                                krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ)->length,
00354                                krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ)->data);
00355                         return -1;
00356                 }
00357         } else {
00358                 if (svc_princ_verify_host(ctx, princ, self_nid, LL_WARN)) {
00359                         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "%.*s: doesn't belong to this node\n",
00360                                krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ)->length,
00361                                krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ)->data);
00362                         return -1;
00363                 }
00364         }
00365 
00366         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "principal is OK\n");
00367         return 0;
00368 }
00369 
00373 static
00374 void get_root_tgt_ccname(char *ccname, int size, unsigned int flag)
00375 {
00376         const char *suffix;
00377 
00378         switch (flag) {
00379         case LGSS_ROOT_CRED_ROOT:
00380                 suffix = krb5_cred_root_suffix;
00381                 break;
00382         case LGSS_ROOT_CRED_MDT:
00383                 suffix = krb5_cred_mds_suffix;
00384                 break;
00385         case LGSS_ROOT_CRED_OST:
00386                 suffix = krb5_cred_oss_suffix;
00387                 break;
00388         default:
00389                 lassert(0);
00390         }
00391 
00392         snprintf(ccname, size, "%s%s/%s%s_%s",
00393                  krb5_cc_type, krb5_cc_dir, krb5_cred_prefix,
00394                  suffix, krb5_this_realm);
00395 }
00396 
00397 static
00398 int lkrb5_check_root_tgt_cc_base(krb5_context ctx,
00399                                  krb5_ccache ccache,
00400                                  char *ccname,
00401                                  unsigned int flag,
00402                                  uint64_t self_nid)
00403 {
00404         krb5_ccache             tgt_ccache;
00405         krb5_creds              cred;
00406         krb5_principal          princ;
00407         krb5_cc_cursor          cursor;
00408         krb5_error_code         code;
00409         time_t                  now;
00410         int                     rc = -1, found = 0;
00411 
00412         /* prepare parsing the cache file */
00413         code = krb5_cc_resolve(ctx, ccname, &tgt_ccache);
00414         if (code) {
00415                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "resolve krb5 cc %s: %s\n",
00416                        ccname, krb5_err_msg(code));
00417                 return -1;
00418         }
00419 
00420         /* checks the principal */
00421         code = krb5_cc_get_principal(ctx, tgt_ccache, &princ);
00422         if (code) {
00423                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "get cc principal: %s\n", krb5_err_msg(code));
00424                 goto out_cc;
00425         }
00426 
00427         if (lkrb5_cc_check_tgt_princ(ctx, tgt_ccache, princ, flag, self_nid))
00428                 goto out_princ;
00429 
00430         /*
00431          * find a valid entry
00432          */
00433         code = krb5_cc_start_seq_get(ctx, tgt_ccache, &cursor);
00434         if (code) {
00435                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "start cc iteration: %s\n", krb5_err_msg(code));
00436                 goto out_princ;
00437         }
00438 
00439         now = time(0);
00440         do {
00441                 krb5_timestamp  duration, delta;
00442 
00443                 code = krb5_cc_next_cred(ctx, tgt_ccache, &cursor, &cred);
00444                 if (code != 0)
00445                         break;
00446 
00447                 logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "cred: server realm %.*s, type %d, name %.*s; "
00448                        "time (%lld-%lld, renew till %lld), valid %lld\n",
00449                        krb5_princ_realm(ctx, cred.server)->length,
00450                        krb5_princ_realm(ctx, cred.server)->data,
00451                        krb5_princ_type(ctx, cred.server),
00452                        krb5_princ_name(ctx, cred.server)->length,
00453                        krb5_princ_name(ctx, cred.server)->data,
00454                        (long long)cred.times.starttime,
00455                        (long long)cred.times.endtime,
00456                        (long long)cred.times.renew_till,
00457                        (long long)(cred.times.endtime - now));
00458 
00459                 /* FIXME
00460                  * we found the princ type is always 0 (KRB5_NT_UNKNOWN), why???
00461                  */
00462 
00463                 /* FIXME how about inter-realm TGT??? FIXME */
00464                 if (lgss_krb5_strcasecmp(krb5_princ_name(ctx, cred.server),
00465                                          "krbtgt"))
00466                         continue;
00467 
00468                 if (lgss_krb5_strcasecmp(krb5_princ_realm(ctx, cred.server),
00469                                          krb5_this_realm))
00470                         continue;
00471 
00472                 /* check validity of time */
00473                 delta = 60 * 30; /* half an hour */
00474                 duration = cred.times.endtime - cred.times.starttime;
00475                 if (duration / 4 < delta)
00476                         delta = duration / 4;
00477 
00478                 if (cred.times.starttime <= now &&
00479                     cred.times.endtime >= now + delta) {
00480                         found = 1;
00481                         break;
00482                 }
00483         } while (1);
00484 
00485         if (!found) {
00486                 logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "doesn't find good TGT cache\n");
00487                 goto out_seq;
00488         }
00489 
00490         /* found a good cred, store it into @ccache */
00491         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "found good TGT cache\n");
00492 
00493         code = krb5_cc_initialize(ctx, ccache, princ);
00494         if (code) {
00495                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "init private cc: %s\n", krb5_err_msg(code));
00496                 goto out_seq;
00497         }
00498 
00499         code = krb5_cc_store_cred(ctx, ccache, &cred);
00500         if (code) {
00501                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "store private cred: %s\n", krb5_err_msg(code));
00502                 goto out_seq;
00503         }
00504 
00505         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "store private ccache OK\n");
00506         rc = 0;
00507 
00508 out_seq:
00509         krb5_cc_end_seq_get(ctx, tgt_ccache, &cursor);
00510 out_princ:
00511         krb5_free_principal(ctx, princ);
00512 out_cc:
00513         krb5_cc_close(ctx, tgt_ccache);
00514 
00515         return rc;
00516 }
00517 
00521 static
00522 int lkrb5_check_root_tgt_cc(krb5_context ctx,
00523                             krb5_ccache ccache,
00524                             unsigned int root_flags,
00525                             uint64_t self_nid)
00526 {
00527         struct stat             statbuf;
00528         unsigned int            flag;
00529         char                    ccname[1024];
00530         char                   *ccfile;
00531         int                     i, rc;
00532 
00533         for (i = 0; i < LGSS_ROOT_CRED_NR; i++) {
00534                 flag = 1 << i;
00535 
00536                 if ((root_flags & flag) == 0)
00537                         continue;
00538 
00539                 get_root_tgt_ccname(ccname, sizeof(ccname), flag);
00540                 logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "root krb5 TGT ccname: %s\n", ccname);
00541 
00542                 /* currently we only support type "FILE", firstly make sure
00543                  * the cache file is there */
00544                 ccfile = ccname + strlen(krb5_cc_type);
00545                 if (stat(ccfile, &statbuf)) {
00546                         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "krb5 cc %s: %s\n",
00547                                ccname, strerror(errno));
00548                         continue;
00549                 }
00550 
00551                 rc = lkrb5_check_root_tgt_cc_base(ctx, ccache, ccname, flag,
00552                                                   self_nid);
00553                 if (rc == 0)
00554                         return 0;
00555         }
00556 
00557         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "doesn't find a valid tgt cc\n");
00558         return -1;
00559 }
00560 
00561 static
00562 int lkrb5_get_root_tgt_keytab(krb5_context ctx,
00563                               krb5_ccache ccache,
00564                               krb5_keytab kt,
00565                               krb5_principal princ,
00566                               const char *ccname)
00567 {
00568         krb5_get_init_creds_opt opts;
00569         krb5_creds              cred;
00570         krb5_ccache             tgt_ccache;
00571         krb5_error_code         code;
00572         int                     rc = -1;
00573 
00574         krb5_get_init_creds_opt_init(&opts);
00575         krb5_get_init_creds_opt_set_address_list(&opts, NULL);
00576         /*
00577          * by default krb5 library obtain ticket with lifetime shorter
00578          * than the max value. we can change it here if we want. but
00579          * seems not necessary now.
00580          *
00581         krb5_get_init_creds_opt_set_tkt_life(&opts, very-long-time);
00582          *
00583          */
00584 
00585         /*
00586          * obtain TGT and store into global ccache
00587          */
00588         code = krb5_get_init_creds_keytab(ctx, &cred, princ, kt,
00589                                           0, NULL, &opts);
00590         if (code) {
00591                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "failed to get root TGT for "
00592                        "principal %.*s: %s\n",
00593                        krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ)->length,
00594                        krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ)->data,
00595                        krb5_err_msg(code));
00596                 return -1;
00597         }
00598 
00599         code = krb5_cc_resolve(ctx, ccname, &tgt_ccache);
00600         if (code) {
00601                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "resolve cc %s: %s\n",
00602                        ccname, krb5_err_msg(code));
00603                 goto out_cred;
00604         }
00605 
00606         code = krb5_cc_initialize(ctx, tgt_ccache, princ);
00607         if (code) {
00608                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "initialize cc %s: %s\n",
00609                        ccname, krb5_err_msg(code));
00610                 goto out_cc;
00611         }
00612 
00613         code = krb5_cc_store_cred(ctx, tgt_ccache, &cred);
00614         if (code) {
00615                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "store cred to cc %s: %s\n",
00616                        ccname, krb5_err_msg(code));
00617                 goto out_cc;
00618         }
00619 
00620         logmsg(LL_INFO, "installed TGT of %.*s in cc %s\n",
00621                krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ)->length,
00622                krb5_princ_name(ctx, princ)->data,
00623                ccname);
00624 
00625         /*
00626          * now store the cred into my own cc too
00627          */
00628         code = krb5_cc_initialize(ctx, ccache, princ);
00629         if (code) {
00630                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "init mem cc: %s\n", krb5_err_msg(code));
00631                 goto out_cc;
00632         }
00633 
00634         code = krb5_cc_store_cred(ctx, ccache, &cred);
00635         if (code) {
00636                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "store mm cred: %s\n", krb5_err_msg(code));
00637                 goto out_cc;
00638         }
00639 
00640         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "stored TGT into mem cc OK\n");
00641         rc = 0;
00642 out_cc:
00643         krb5_cc_close(ctx, tgt_ccache);
00644 out_cred:
00645         krb5_free_cred_contents(ctx, &cred);
00646         return rc;
00647 }
00648 
00649 /*
00650  * obtain a new root TGT
00651  */
00652 static
00653 int lkrb5_refresh_root_tgt_cc(krb5_context ctx,
00654                               krb5_ccache ccache,
00655                               unsigned int root_flags,
00656                               uint64_t self_nid)
00657 {
00658         krb5_keytab             kt;
00659         krb5_keytab_entry       kte;
00660         krb5_kt_cursor          cursor;
00661         krb5_principal          princ = NULL;
00662         krb5_error_code         code;
00663         char                    ccname[1024];
00664         unsigned int            flag = 0;
00665         int                     rc = -1;
00666 
00667         /* prepare parsing the keytab file */
00668         code = krb5_kt_resolve(ctx, krb5_keytab_file, &kt);
00669         if (code) {
00670                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "resolve keytab %s: %s\n",
00671                        krb5_keytab_file, krb5_err_msg(code));
00672                 return -1;
00673         }
00674 
00675         code = krb5_kt_start_seq_get(ctx, kt, &cursor);
00676         if (code) {
00677                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "start kt iteration: %s\n", krb5_err_msg(code));
00678                 goto out_kt;
00679         }
00680 
00681         /* iterate keytab to find proper an entry */
00682         do {
00683                 krb5_data      *princname;
00684 
00685                 code = krb5_kt_next_entry(ctx, kt, &kte, &cursor);
00686                 if (code != 0)
00687                         break;
00688 
00689                 logmsg(LL_TRACE, "kt entry: realm %.*s, type %d, "
00690                        "size %d, name %.*s\n",
00691                        krb5_princ_realm(ctx, kte.principal)->length,
00692                        krb5_princ_realm(ctx, kte.principal)->data,
00693                        krb5_princ_type(ctx, kte.principal),
00694                        krb5_princ_size(ctx, kte.principal),
00695                        krb5_princ_name(ctx, kte.principal)->length,
00696                        krb5_princ_name(ctx, kte.principal)->data);
00697 
00698                 if (!princ_is_local_realm(ctx, kte.principal))
00699                         continue;
00700 
00701                 princname = krb5_princ_name(ctx, kte.principal);
00702 
00703                 if ((root_flags & LGSS_ROOT_CRED_ROOT) != 0 &&
00704                     lgss_krb5_strcmp(princname, LGSS_USR_ROOT_STR) == 0) {
00705                         flag = LGSS_ROOT_CRED_ROOT;
00706                 } else if ((root_flags & LGSS_ROOT_CRED_MDT) != 0 &&
00707                            lgss_krb5_strcmp(princname, LGSS_SVC_MDS_STR) == 0) {
00708                         flag = LGSS_ROOT_CRED_MDT;
00709                 } else if ((root_flags & LGSS_ROOT_CRED_OST) != 0 &&
00710                            lgss_krb5_strcmp(princname, LGSS_SVC_OSS_STR) == 0) {
00711                         flag = LGSS_ROOT_CRED_OST;
00712                 } else {
00713                         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "not what we want, skip\n");
00714                         continue;
00715                 }
00716 
00717                 if (krb5_princ_component(ctx, kte.principal, 1) == NULL) {
00718                         if (flag != LGSS_ROOT_CRED_ROOT) {
00719                                 logmsg(LL_TRACE, "no hostname, skip\n");
00720                                 continue;
00721                         }
00722                 } else {
00723                         if (svc_princ_verify_host(ctx, kte.principal, self_nid,
00724                                                   LL_TRACE)) {
00725                                 logmsg(LL_TRACE, "doesn't belong to this "
00726                                        "node, skip\n");
00727                                 continue;
00728                         }
00729                 }
00730 
00731                 code = krb5_copy_principal(ctx, kte.principal, &princ);
00732                 if (code) {
00733                         logmsg(LL_ERR, "copy princ: %s\n", krb5_err_msg(code));
00734                         continue;
00735                 }
00736 
00737                 lassert(princ != NULL);
00738                 break;
00739         } while (1);
00740 
00741         krb5_kt_end_seq_get(ctx, kt, &cursor);
00742 
00743         if (princ == NULL) {
00744                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "can't find proper keytab entry\n");
00745                 goto out_kt;
00746         }
00747 
00748         /* obtain root TGT */
00749         get_root_tgt_ccname(ccname, sizeof(ccname), flag);
00750         rc = lkrb5_get_root_tgt_keytab(ctx, ccache, kt, princ, ccname);
00751 
00752         krb5_free_principal(ctx, princ);
00753 out_kt:
00754         krb5_kt_close(ctx, kt);
00755         return rc;
00756 }
00757 
00758 static
00759 int lkrb5_prepare_root_cred(struct lgss_cred *cred)
00760 {
00761         krb5_context            ctx;
00762         krb5_ccache             ccache;
00763         krb5_error_code         code;
00764         struct lgss_krb5_cred  *kcred;
00765         int                     rc = -1;
00766 
00767         lassert(krb5_this_realm != NULL);
00768 
00769         kcred = (struct lgss_krb5_cred *) cred->lc_mech_cred;
00770 
00771         /* compose the memory cc name, since the only user is myself,
00772          * the name could be fixed */
00773         snprintf(kcred->kc_ccname, sizeof(kcred->kc_ccname),
00774                  "%s/self", krb5_cc_type_mem);
00775         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "private cc: %s\n", kcred->kc_ccname);
00776 
00777         code = krb5_init_context(&ctx);
00778         if (code) {
00779                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "initialize krb5 context: %s\n",
00780                        krb5_err_msg(code));
00781                 return -1;
00782         }
00783 
00784         code = krb5_cc_resolve(ctx, kcred->kc_ccname, &ccache);
00785         if (code) {
00786                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "resolve krb5 cc %s: %s\n",
00787                        kcred->kc_ccname, krb5_err_msg(code));
00788                 goto out_ctx;
00789         }
00790 
00791         /*
00792          * search and/or obtain root TGT credential.
00793          * it touched global (on-disk) tgt cache, do it inside mutex locking
00794          */
00795         lgss_krb5_mutex_lock();
00796 
00797         rc = lkrb5_check_root_tgt_cc(ctx, ccache, cred->lc_root_flags,
00798                                      cred->lc_self_nid);
00799         if (rc != 0)
00800                 rc = lkrb5_refresh_root_tgt_cc(ctx, ccache,
00801                                                cred->lc_root_flags,
00802                                                cred->lc_self_nid);
00803 
00804         if (rc == 0)
00805                 rc = lgss_krb5_set_ccache_name(kcred->kc_ccname);
00806 
00807         lgss_krb5_mutex_unlock();
00808 
00809         krb5_cc_close(ctx, ccache);
00810 out_ctx:
00811         krb5_free_context(ctx);
00812 
00813         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "prepare root credentail %s\n", rc ? "failed" : "OK");
00814         return rc;
00815 }
00816 
00817 static
00818 int lkrb5_prepare_user_cred(struct lgss_cred *cred)
00819 {
00820         struct lgss_krb5_cred   *kcred;
00821         int                      rc;
00822 
00823         lassert(krb5_this_realm == NULL);
00824 
00825         kcred = (struct lgss_krb5_cred *) cred->lc_mech_cred;
00826 
00827         /*
00828          * here we just specified a fix ccname, instead of searching
00829          * entire cc dir. is this OK??
00830          */
00831         snprintf(kcred->kc_ccname, sizeof(kcred->kc_ccname),
00832                  "%s%s/%s%u",
00833                  krb5_cc_type, krb5_cc_dir, krb5_cred_prefix, cred->lc_uid);
00834         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "using krb5 cache name: %s\n", kcred->kc_ccname);
00835 
00836         rc = lgss_krb5_set_ccache_name(kcred->kc_ccname);
00837         if (rc)
00838                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "can't set krb5 ccache name: %s\n",
00839                        kcred->kc_ccname);
00840 
00841         return rc;
00842 }
00843 
00844 static
00845 int lgss_krb5_prepare_cred(struct lgss_cred *cred)
00846 {
00847         struct lgss_krb5_cred  *kcred;
00848         int                     rc;
00849 
00850         kcred = malloc(sizeof(*kcred));
00851         if (kcred == NULL) {
00852                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "can't allocate krb5 cred\n");
00853                 return -1;
00854         }
00855 
00856         kcred->kc_ccname[0] = '\0';
00857         kcred->kc_remove = 0;
00858         cred->lc_mech_cred = kcred;
00859 
00860         if (cred->lc_root_flags != 0) {
00861                 if (lgss_krb5_get_local_realm())
00862                         return -1;
00863 
00864                 rc = lkrb5_prepare_root_cred(cred);
00865         } else {
00866                 rc = lkrb5_prepare_user_cred(cred);
00867         }
00868 
00869         return rc;
00870 }
00871 
00872 static
00873 void lgss_krb5_release_cred(struct lgss_cred *cred)
00874 {
00875         struct lgss_krb5_cred   *kcred;
00876 
00877         kcred = (struct lgss_krb5_cred *) cred->lc_mech_cred;
00878 
00879         free(kcred);
00880         cred->lc_mech_cred = NULL;
00881 }
00882 
00883 struct lgss_mech_type lgss_mech_krb5 = 
00884 {
00885         .lmt_name               = "krb5",
00886         .lmt_mech_n             = LGSS_MECH_KRB5,
00887         .lmt_prepare_cred       = lgss_krb5_prepare_cred,
00888         .lmt_release_cred       = lgss_krb5_release_cred,
00889 };
